page.title: 07LIFE STYLE
page.content: TEVERSHAM From a very small village Teversham has grown a little in size because of the housing need for workers in the nearby Marshall's Group. A few residents are agricultural workers on the farm in the village, but many residents now work at Marshalls or at various businesses in Cambridge, a very small proportion commute to London each day. The residents on the 'Council' estate within the City boundary work in varied capacities in Cambridge city. The children of Fen Ditton and Teversham are lucky enough to attend their village primary schools. Leaving these at eleven years of age most children living within this 'bloc' continue education at Bottisham Village College,two miles away.
